newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.02 up at 42.28 to the dollar in the kerb market on Tuesday on profit-taking in the U.S. currency, which rose sharply last week, dealers said.

"The dollar gained sharply last weak and a technical dip was due," dealer Owais Kalia said. "But the rupee will remain under pressure because of the country's weak economic fundamentals. The demand for the dollar will increase in the coming weeks."
The State (cnetrla) Bank of Pakistan rate, last fixed on May 23, was 40.3900/40.5920 against the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates was steady at 4.30 percent.
